description:
In this talk I will demonstrate how to create Artificial Life in a
computer using Python and its wonderful libraries.

The Python program, called “Lenia”, is developed to discover/evolve new
life species, using its interactive UI to facilitate Evolutionary
Algorithms (EA). A video recorded from the program won the Virtual
Creatures Contest in GECCO conference 2018, Kyoto.

| It utilizes the following libraries:
| – NumPy for matrix calculation
| – PyOpenCL/PyCUDA and Reikna for GPU acceleration – SciPy and
  PIL/Pillow for image processing
| – Tkinter (and potentially Matplotlib) for interactive UI – Subprocess
  and FFmpeg for real-time video

Lenia is now open source at https://github.com/Chakazul/Lenia
title: How to Evolve Life using Python
